column4: hi! is there a way to just build the generic kernel from the 2.6.20 feisty kernel
it lasted over 5 hours to build me the whole stuff from this package
don't bother unless you absolutely need to
there must be an option, an argument i think?
nope
Why are you building a custom kernel?  Do you really need to?
yes i do
i build kernels now over five years, so this is not the problem, i just wanted to stick to the ubuntu packages
what is the need that the stock kernel does not address for you?
some patches, for exampe acpi ones
and the ubuntu version is more integrated
i do not have to google hours to search important patches and apply them myself
if you want packages, be sure to install kernel-package and use make-kpkg
some even get rejected, i have to fix them to apply mysel
okay ;-) sorry, i do not think you can really help me
you haven't asked anything
as i said above, i build debian kernel images for years now
i did
i get the linux-image source from the feisty kernel
agfter that i ran a dpkg-buildpackage to compile it on edgy
problem is: bigiron, 386, etc. kernels are build this needs 5 hours
i just want to compile the generic version
You can't, as I said, from the linux-source packages
i think i can, i just look into debian/rules
but i thought somebody has it handy for me already
just found it
in debian/control i just comment out the packages i do not need
